Package uk.ac.aber.cs21120.interfaces

Interface IGrid

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Grid
    public interface IGrid
    This is the interface for a Sudoku grid, encapsulating a 9x9 board

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  IGrid.BadCellException
      An exception which is thrown if the coordinates are out of range.
      static class  IGrid.BadDigitException
      You should throw this exception when you try to set() an invalid digit.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int get​(int x, int y)
      Get the value of the given cell in the grid as a digit from 1-9, or 0 if the cell is empty.
      boolean isValid()
      Return true if the grid is valid.
      void set​(int x, int y, int val)
      Set the value of the given cell in the grid.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        int get​(int x,
        int y)
 throws IGrid.BadCellException
        Get the value of the given cell in the grid as a digit from 1-9, or 0 if the cell is empty. BadCellException is thrown if the coordinates are out of range.
        Parameters:
        x - column number
        y - row number
        Returns:
        digit from 1-9, or 0 if cell is empty
        Throws:
        IGrid.BadCellException

      • set

        void set​(int x,
         int y,
         int val)
  throws IGrid.BadCellException,
         IGrid.BadDigitException
        Set the value of the given cell in the grid. BadCellException is thrown if the coordinates are out of range.
        Parameters:
        x - column number
        y - row number
        val - digit from 1-9, or 0 for an empty cell
        Throws:
        IGrid.BadCellException
        IGrid.BadDigitException

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Return true if the grid is valid. This means that all non-empty cells meet the following conditions: 1) each digit appears only once in each row 2) each digit appears only once in each column 3) each digit appears only once in each 3x3 subgrid Note that empty cells are not counted.
        Returns:
        true if the grid is valid.
